definition: to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: The angel stared out at the rushing hedgerows.
sentences.chinese: 天使盯着匆匆逃命的刺猬们。

sentences.english: I don't want you to jump ship just yet.
sentences.chinese: 我还没有说要你弃船逃命呢。

sentences.english: The fox ran for his life toward the woods.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸向森林里逃命去了。

sentences.english: Office workers ran for their lives as an earth tremor shook the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 地颤使镇中心摇晃时，工作人员都各自逃命。

sentences.english: He told him that he had three days to hightail it or there'd turn into a showdown.
sentences.chinese: 艾顿通告他有三天的时间逃命，否则就是摊牌。

sentences.english: The party defeated the helmet of rejected will inevitably, flying for lost.
sentences.chinese: 厮杀结果，打败的一方免不了会弃盔丢甲，飞奔逃命。

sentences.english: They are forced to escape, in order to elute the suspect, must solve the mystery of language.
sentences.chinese: 两人被逼逃命，为了洗脱嫌疑，必须解开语言之谜。

sentences.english: The derrick escape line has to be function-tested.
sentences.chinese: 井架工逃命绳要做功能试验。

sentences.english: But it's also true that al-Qaeda in Iraq is on the run.
sentences.chinese: 但是伊拉克的基地组织在忙着逃命也是事实。

sentences.english: Earthworm escape, water snakes come ashore.
Several men were falsely accused of having dressed as women in order to save their lives.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些人因此被诬告装成女人来逃命。

sentences.english: In a locked cab, I don't hold high hopes for the cab driver.
sentences.chinese: 在一个锁了门的车里，我想司机逃命的机会不大。

sentences.english: Sheep all day long just to escape even faster to eat grass not do it.
sentences.chinese: 羊群一天到晚只是逃命，连草都快吃不成了。

sentences.english: The defeated soldiers, throwing away their helmets and armour 5, flee for their lives.
sentences.chinese: 被打败的士兵丢盔弃甲，抱头逃命。

sentences.english: In the scramble to escape certain death, Wam grabbed a hunting rifle that had fallen into the pit.
sentences.chinese: 在逃命的过程中，万抢到一把掉入洞中的猎枪。

sentences.english: Smee , decided to abandon the ship by jumping down into the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们和斯米先生决定弃船，跳水逃命。

definition: to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to run away/to flee in disarray
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to leave in stealth/to slip away
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
